title: Thomas Frank hails Frank Lampard and  clear favourite Chelsea
body_text:
Brentford boss Thomas Frank has lauded Chelsea head coach Frank Lampard and has labelled the Blues as ‘clear favourites’ for their west London derby.
Lampard returned to Stamford Bridge for his second managerial stint at the club earlier this month following the sacking of Graham Potter.
It has been a horrific start for the former midfielder with Chelsea losing all four games under him thus far and crashing out of the Champions League.
But Frank has argued that Lampard has improved Chelsea and says the Blues are still favourites heading into Wednesday’s meeting with the Bees at Stamford Bridge, despite Brentford being higher than them in the Premier League table.
‘I think we all know that Chelsea have been struggling a little bit this season,’ Frank said on Tuesday.
‘[They have] very good players. I know they haven’t won, but I think clearly in the four games [Lampard] has been in charge they are playing with bigger energy, more intensity on the eye and also on the numbers.
‘It’s top players, and at the end of the day they bought players for £600 million in the past two transfer windows and they haven’t forgotten how to play football.

‘Sometimes it takes one moment. Now they had a good week to work with them at Stamford Bridge. They are clear favourites of course. They should be. But we hope and believe that we can do something.’
Brentford sit one spot above 11th-placed Chelsea – who are five points behind Frank’s side – although the Bees have played one game more.
The sides played out a 0-0 draw in the reverse fixture at the Gtech Community Stadium in October.
